title: Appeals Court Ruling Allows Trump to Deploy National Guard Troops to Portland
summary: Deployment can move forward, for now, under a preliminary ruling by the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. But legal wrangling will likely continue.

title: White House’s East Wing Partially Demolished to Build Trump’s Ballroom
summary: The president had pledged that construction wouldn’t “interfere with the current building,” a promise that always seemed unrealistic given the grand scale of the plans.

title: All but 2 Universities Decline a Trump Offer of Preferential Funding
summary: One of the two, Vanderbilt University, signaled it had reservations.

title: White House Works to Preserve Gaza Deal Amid Concerns About Netanyahu
summary: The Trump administration strategy is to try to keep Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel from resuming an all-out assault against Hamas, U.S. officials said.

title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation Operations Unravel
summary: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation has suspended its aid operations because of the cease-fire, but it is also running low on funds and faces logistical obstacles to resuming its work.

title: Can an Israel Philharmonic Concert Be Just About Music?
summary: In the days following a cease-fire in Gaza, the orchestra returned to New York under circumstances that were more tense than usual.

title: Louvre Museum Remains Closed After Jewelry Robbery: What to Know
summary: A stunning heist has raised uncomfortable questions about security at the Paris museum.

title: Colin Jost, Pete Davidson and the Staten Island Ferry Fiasco
summary: Nearly four years after they bought an out-of-service ferryboat for $280,100, their plans for a floating event space may be running aground.

title: To Counter China’s Hold on Rare Minerals, Trump Turns to Australia
summary: The United States hopes to become less dependent on China by increasing access to mineral-rich countries. Rare earth metals are vital to an array of modern industries.

title: Amazon’s AWS Disruption Creates Outages for Hundreds of Websites for Hours
summary: Amazon Web Services, a major provider of cloud services, cited a problem at its data center in Northern Virginia. The outage highlighted the fragility of global internet infrastructure.

title: How an Elite Public High School Set Mamdani on the Path to Politics
summary: Zohran Mamdani’s time at the Bronx High School of Science expanded and helped shape his views of New York, from the cricket pitch to politics.

title: A Boston Restaurant Displayed Whitey Bulger’s Mug Shot. An Uproar Ensued.
summary: The owners of Savin Bar & Kitchen have so far rejected requests from residents to remove photos of gangsters who terrorized the city for decades.

title: Your November Election Guide (Yes, This November)
summary: It’s not a presidential election year, or even the midterms, but races this fall will offer a sense of voters’ moods in the first year of the new Trump administration.

title: What to Know About the California Special Election
summary: Some 23 million voters have received mail ballots for the Nov. 4 election. The only statewide measure this fall is a redistricting plan spearheaded by Gov. Gavin Newsom.

title: With SpaceX Behind Schedule, NASA Will Seek More Moon Lander Ideas
summary: Blue Origin, owned by Jeff Bezos, and Lockheed Martin are among the contractors that may compete with Elon Musk’s company in the race back to the lunar surface.

title: Fallen Confederate Statues Take Center Stage in the Year’s Boldest Show
summary: “Monuments,” a group exhibition in Los Angeles, led by Kara Walker, places contemporary art face to face with statuary removed in the last decade.

title: Running a Local Paper? In This Economy?
summary: They were journalists at major news outlets in New York and D.C. before taking big pay cuts to run the Midcoast Villager, a paper covering a rocky, coastal part of Maine.

title: Trump Posted a Video of Himself Dumping Excrement on Our Cities. It’s a Glimpse of His Deepest Drives.
summary: A perverse delight in degradation has always coursed through MAGA circles.

title: George Santos and President Trump’s Theory of Mercy
summary: More than any other presidential actions, clemencies tell us who presidents are.

summary: Also, the search is on for the Louvre jewel thieves. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Iranian Wedding Video Plunges Top Official Into Scandal
summary: Rear Adm. Ali Shamkhani oversaw a brutal crackdown on women, but traditional notions of Islamic morality were little on display at his daughter’s wedding.

title: Daniel Naroditsky, Chess Grandmaster, Dies at 29
summary: He earned the highest title in the chess world as he built a career as an accomplished chess teacher, commentator and author.

title: Man Is Arrested After Threatening to Open Fire at Atlanta Airport, Police Say
summary: The man, Billy J. Cagle, 49, was arrested after family members told the police that he was headed to the airport, “in their words, ‘to shoot it up,’” Atlanta’s police chief said.

title: A Flat $40 Train Ticket From NYC to Albany? It’s Happening Next Year.
summary: For the first time, Metro-North will run trains past Poughkeepsie through the Hudson Valley to Albany. Some Amtrak service will also be restored.
